bwwExcerpt: Tom Hiddleston is back on stage, bringing Jamie Lloyd's six-month all-hands-on-deck salute to Harold Pinter at the West End theatre that bears his name to an immensely satisfying climax - one which not only re-confirms Betrayal as a modern masterpiece, built to last, but reassures us that Hiddleston has got the theatrical acting chops to head up there among the greats.
rejectionReasoning: claude: This review is about a West End production in London, not a current Broadway production; gemini: This review discusses a West End (London) production, not a Broadway one.; kimi: The review explicitly discusses the West End production at the Harold Pinter Theatre in London ('West End theatre that bears his name'), not the current Broadway production.
